verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Shoshannim. <S%H7799><s%> [A Psalm] of David.) Save <S%H3467><s%> me, O God, <S%H430><s%> For the waters <S%H4325><s%> have threatened <S%H935><s%> <S%H5704><s%> my life. <S%H5315><s%>

I have sunk <S%H2883><s%> in deep <S%H4688><s%> mire, <S%H3121><s%> and there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> foothold; <S%H4613><s%> I have come <S%H935><s%> into deep <S%H4615><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> and a flood <S%H9578><s%> overflows <S%H7857><s%> me.
I am weary <S%H3021><s%> with my crying; <S%H7121><s%> my throat <S%H1627><s%> is parched; <S%H2787><s%> My eyes <S%H5869><s%> fail <S%H3615><s%> while I wait <S%H3176><s%> for my God. <S%H430><s%>

Those who hate <S%H8130><s%> me without <S%H2600><s%> a cause <S%H2600><s%> are more <S%H7231><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the hairs <S%H8185><s%> of my head; <S%H7218><s%> Those who would destroy <S%H6789><s%> me are powerful, <S%H6105><s%> being wrongfully <S%H8267><s%> my enemies, <S%H340><s%> What <S%H834><s%> I did not steal, <S%H1497><s%> I then <S%H227><s%> have to restore. <S%H7725><s%>
O God, <S%H430><s%> it is Thou who dost know <S%H3045><s%> my folly, <S%H200><s%> And my wrongs <S%H819><s%> are not hidden <S%H3582><s%> from Thee.

May those who wait <S%H6960><s%> for Thee not be ashamed <S%H954><s%> through me, O Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3068><s%> of hosts; <S%H6635><s%> May those who seek <S%H1245><s%> Thee not be dishonored <S%H3637><s%> through me, O God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%>
Because <S%H3588><s%> for Thy sake <S%H5921><s%> I have borne <S%H5375><s%> reproach; <S%H2781><s%> Dishonor <S%H3639><s%> has covered <S%H3680><s%> my face. <S%H6440><s%>
I have <S%H1961><s%> become <S%H1961><s%> estranged <S%H2114><s%> from my brothers, <S%H251><s%> And an alien <S%H5237><s%> to my mother's sons. <S%H1121><s%>
For zeal <S%H7068><s%> for Thy house <S%H1004><s%> has consumed <S%H398><s%> me, And the reproaches <S%H2781><s%> of those who reproach <S%H2778><s%> Thee have fallen <S%H5307><s%> on me.
When I wept <S%H1058><s%> in my soul <S%H5315><s%> with fasting, <S%H6685><s%> It became <S%H1961><s%> my reproach. <S%H2781><s%>
When I made <S%H5414><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> my clothing, <S%H3830><s%> I became <S%H1961><s%> a byword <S%H4912><s%> to them.
Those who sit <S%H3427><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%> talk <S%H7878><s%> about me, And I [am] the song <S%H5058><s%> of the drunkards. <S%H7941><s%> <S%H8354><s%>

But as for me, my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is to Thee, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> at an acceptable <S%H7522><s%> time; <S%H6256><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of Thy lovingkindness, <S%H2617><s%> Answer <S%H6030><s%> me with Thy saving <S%H3468><s%> truth. <S%H571><s%>

Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from the mire, <S%H2916><s%> and do not let me sink; <S%H2883><s%> May I be delivered <S%H5337><s%> from my foes, <S%H8130><s%> and from the deep <S%H4615><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

May the flood <S%H9578><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> not overflow <S%H7857><s%> me, And may the deep <S%H4688><s%> not swallow <S%H1104><s%> me up, And may the pit <S%H875><s%> not shut <S%H332><s%> its mouth <S%H6310><s%> on me.

Answer <S%H6030><s%> me, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for Thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> is good; <S%H2896><s%> According to the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of Thy compassion, <S%H7356><s%> turn <S%H6437><s%> to me,
And do not hide <S%H5641><s%> Thy face <S%H6440><s%> from Thy servant, <S%H5650><s%> For I am in distress; <S%H9503><s%> answer <S%H6030><s%> me quickly. <S%H4118><s%>
Oh draw <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> to my soul <S%H5315><s%> [and] redeem <S%H1350><s%> it; Ransom <S%H6299><s%> me because <S%H4616><s%> of my enemies! <S%H340><s%>
Thou dost know <S%H3045><s%> my reproach <S%H2781><s%> and my shame <S%H1322><s%> and my dishonor; <S%H3639><s%> All <S%H3605><s%> my adversaries <S%H6887><s%> are before <S%H5048><s%> Thee.

Reproach <S%H2781><s%> has broken <S%H7665><s%> my heart, <S%H3820><s%> and I am so sick. <S%H5136><s%> And I looked <S%H6960><s%> for sympathy, <S%H5110><s%> but there <S%H369><s%> was none, <S%H369><s%> And for comforters, <S%H5162><s%> but I found <S%H4672><s%> none. <S%H3808><s%>
They also gave <S%H5414><s%> me gall <S%H7219><s%> for my food, <S%H1267><s%> And for my thirst <S%H6772><s%> they gave <S%H8248><s%> me vinegar <S%H2558><s%> to drink. <S%H8248><s%>
May their table <S%H7979><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them become <S%H1961><s%> a snare; <S%H4170><s%> And when they are in peace, <S%H7965><s%> [may it become] a trap. <S%H4170><s%>

May their eyes <S%H5869><s%> grow <S%H2821><s%> dim <S%H2821><s%> so <S%H4480><s%> that they cannot <S%H4480><s%> see, <S%H7200><s%> And make their loins <S%H4975><s%> shake <S%H4571><s%> continually. <S%H8548><s%>
Pour <S%H8210><s%> out Thine indignation <S%H2195><s%> on them, And may Thy burning <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> overtake <S%H5381><s%> them.
May their camp <S%H2918><s%> be desolate; <S%H8074><s%> May none <S%H408><s%> dwell <S%H3427><s%> in their tents. <S%H168><s%>

For they have persecuted <S%H7291><s%> him whom <S%H834><s%> Thou Thyself <S%H859><s%> hast smitten, <S%H5221><s%> And they tell <S%H5608><s%> of the pain <S%H4341><s%> of those whom Thou hast wounded. <S%H2491><s%>
Do Thou add <S%H5414><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> to their iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> And may they not come <S%H935><s%> into Thy righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>
May they be blotted <S%H4229><s%> out of the book <S%H5612><s%> of life, <S%H2416><s%> And may they not be recorded <S%H3789><s%> with the righteous. <S%H6662><s%>
But I am afflicted <S%H6041><s%> and in pain; <S%H3510><s%> May Thy salvation, <S%H3444><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> set <S%H7682><s%> me [securely] on high. <S%H7682><s%>
I will praise <S%H1984><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> with song, <S%H7892><s%> And shall magnify <S%H1431><s%> Him with thanksgiving. <S%H8426><s%>

And it will please <S%H3190><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> better <S%H3190><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%> [Or] a young <S%H6499><s%> bull <S%H6499><s%> with horns <S%H7161><s%> and hoofs. <S%H6536><s%>
The humble <S%H6035><s%> have seen <S%H7200><s%> [it and] are glad; <S%H8055><s%> You who seek <S%H1875><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> let your heart <S%H3824><s%> revive. <S%H2421><s%>
For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> hears <S%H8085><s%> the needy, <S%H34><s%> And does not despise <S%H959><s%> His [who are] prisoners. <S%H615><s%>
Let heaven <S%H8064><s%> and earth <S%H776><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> Him, The seas <S%H3220><s%> and everything <S%H3605><s%> that moves <S%H7430><s%> in them.

For God <S%H430><s%> will save <S%H3467><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%> and build <S%H1129><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> That they may dwell <S%H3427><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> and possess <S%H3423><s%> it.
And the descendants <S%H2233><s%> of His servants <S%H5650><s%> will inherit <S%H5157><s%> it, And those who love <S%H157><s%> His name <S%H8034><s%> will dwell <S%H7931><s%> in it.
